text: The Rhodes Scholarship named after Cecil Rhodes is an international award to go to school at the University of Oxford and was the first large-scale group of international scholarships.The American Rhodes Scholarships: A Review of the First Forty Years, Review author[s]: Harvie Branscomb, The American Historical Review Â© 1947 American Historical Association ==Famous Rhodes Scholars== * Bill Clinton, United States president * Howard Florey, Australian scientist and Nobel Prize winner * Bob Hawke, Australian Prime Minister and union leader (1953) * Walter Isaacson, Managing editor of Time Magazine, CEO of CNN, CEO Aspen Institute. * Kris Kristofferson, American singer and actor. * Don McNeill, Canadian journalist and George Polk Award winner (1958) ==References== Category:Education
title: Rhodes Scholarship
